channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump said foreign countries would ‘eat’ tariffs—but U.S. consumers and businesses will actually pay 75% at best
item.description: Goldman Sachs estimates U.S. consumers now shoulder two-thirds of President Trump’s new tariff costs, with more companies planning to pass them on in ...

item.title: Why HR should pay more attention to buzzwords like ‘quiet quitting’ and ‘coffee badging’
item.description: Are buzzwords like “quiet quitting,” “coffee badging,” and “workcations" the sign of larger institutional problems? Here's why HR leaders should pay a...

item.title: The ‘Fed put’ is back: If Tuesday’s inflation report is bad expect chaos in the markets
item.description: Investors think the Fed will almost definitely cut interest rates in September, and they are hoping that the consumer price inflation report—due tomor...

item.title: The rise (and risks) of interim CEO roles
item.description: More leaders are stepping into the corner office temporarily. But the gig doesn’t always pay off.

item.title: Trump’s regulatory reset leaves crypto privacy tools like Tornado Cash in the lurch
item.description: A federal jury found a developer guilty last week for creating software, throwing the future of privacy tech into question.
